intro: Randonia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali randonia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils and can withstand periods of drought. Randonia somalensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
